name: Negami's conjecture
rephrased: A finite graph has a planar cover (a finite planar graph that maps onto it in a specific way) if and only if it can be embedded into the projective plane.
implication_form: If a graph can be embedded into the projective plane, then it has a planar cover.
explained: Negami's conjecture states that a finite graph has a planar cover if and only if it can be embedded into the projective plane. A planar cover is a finite covering graph of the original graph that is itself planar. This conjecture proposes a deep equivalence between the existence of a planar covering and the projective planarity of a graph.
